body:
@guilleiguaran I have a use case for the `config.assets.manifest` in Rails 3.2.x

I compile my assets locally to `/public/assets/` (non version-controlled) with `manifest.yml` in a separate folder (version-controlled). I then push my compiled assets to an asset server (Amazon S3), and I push `manifest.yml` to my production web servers. I then set `config.action_controller.asset_host = "//xxx.s3.amazonaws.com"`.

In Rails 3.2.x it seems a local copy of `manifest.yml` is required even when using a remote asset host (see https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/3577)

If Rails 4 looks up `manifest.yml` on the remote asset_host (if set) rather than requiring it locally, then I would no longer need this config.
